description: Senior military officer providing strategic direction to the ANG enterprise to include strategic planning, resource, and the federal and state relationship, DOD budgets and requirements management to meet federal and State missions were successfully managed. Represented the National Guard position, requirements with Congress, Governors and Federal agencies. Excellent communicator and leader. Total Force integration, modernization, recapitalization and strategic direction were major program activities. Served as the Deputy Chief of Staff for Logistics for the Air National Guard of the United States. In this position, oversight of Air Guard aircraft maintenance, supply, transportation resources and personnel.Represented the ANG with USAF, DOD, several states, industry and other stakeholders.

education.name: Kennedy School of Government, Harvard University

description: Senior military commander of a 1100 person Air National Guard unit, comprised of C-130 aircraft, civil engineers,security, communications, cyber and other AF specialities. Homeland Secruity, federal/State resource management and personnel management are areas of expetise. Directed the largest and sustained war fighting effort in Guard history. As Deputy Adjutant General transformed the State support to civil authorities command and control to a joint force operation. Hurricane Kayrina, Emily etc., are examples of state support,Directed State effort that successfully overturned DOD recommendation to shutter the Delaware Air National Guard. Hands on leader who led upgrade of facilities for Army and Air National Guard. Innovative leadership resulted in organizations attainment of full manning, first in over 20 years for the unit.

description: Manages and mentors a team of 264 employees in 6 divisions in 17 careers fields including operations, maintenance, logistics, and training providing command and control of air and space power in United States Southern Command's area of responsibility to include 31 countries covering 1/6 of the world's land mass and 559 million people. Oversees 6 Operations Managers and manages all HR functions including employee reviews, performance issues, evaluations, discipline issues, training, manning requirements, etc. Primary advisor to Company President on actionable items. • Managed $55M facility and orchestrated daily operations, manpower requests, and advanced training for 6 major joint and coalition exercises • Directed/supervised logistical support for two major training events involving 18 partner nations resulting in training for 583 employees and validation of company mission and inter-operability functions • Guided 6 divisions through 50 manpower cuts; redistributed duties in a logical manner averting mission impact • Oversaw $2.7M budget for annual operations and acquisition of 25 advanced training events

description: Supervises and directs 51 employees in 6 branches charged with the execution of the Air Tasking Order in support of Headquarters 12th Air Force’s mission of drug interdiction, foreign disaster relief, and humanitarian support. Coordinates manpower, training, and logistics for exercises and contingencies supporting humanitarian assistance and foreign disaster relief operations in 31 countries covering 1/6 of the world's land mass and 559 million people. Oversees 6 branch Managers and manages all HR functions including employee reviews, performance issues, evaluations, discipline issues, training, manning requirements, etc. Primary advisor to Division Chief on actionable items. • Managed $6M Command and Control equipment suite—led daily operations of 6 branches provided higher headquarters with vital air picture to combat 1.3k narcotics trafficking missions resulting in the seizure of $574M worth of drugs • Identified 20 training deficiencies; guided fix actions resulting in decreased training timelines and increased standardized instructor effect • Oversaw $60K budget for 25 advanced training events

description: Leads 44 employees on more than 330 live missile firings and 3K combat training/test aircraft training missions in the Gulf of Mexico annually. Advises company President on operational and administrative policies and procedures including hiring, training, promotion, retention, and other HR functions. Plans, conducts, and supervises every aspect of training and evaluation of company personnel. Tracks and analyzes operational effectiveness for Company President. • Oversaw daily operation of a $10M Command and Control System utilized to support live-fire operational testing and evaluation of air-to-air weapons systems against a myriad of threat-representative targets • Managed headquarters compliance inspection for 6 shops encompassing 8 programs; guided program managers/fixed discrepancies resulting in no discrepancies and recognition of 3 superior teams and 2 top performers • Revamped 20 year old unit training program based on situational need; created 4 new certifications—reduced qualification timelines by 60% • Filled in as company’s Operations Director for 8 months—managed daily operations and administration for 44 employees--balanced mission requirements, personnel needs without compromising mission requirements

description: Counter Radio-Controlled Improvised Explosive Device expert utilizing Counter-Radio Controlled Electronic Warfare (CREW) systems to combat the threat of improvised explosive devices. Provided commanders and their staffs guidance on how the electromagnetic spectrum can impact operations and how friendly Electronic Warfare can be used to gain an advantage in support of tactical and operational objectives across the full spectrum of operations. Provided coordination between air and ground units for electronic attack (EA) mission support requests and electromagnetic spectrum deconfliction. • Led counter-Improvised Explosive Device (IED) operations during Operation Iraqi Freedom (OIF) deployment supporting US Army sustainment efforts—protected 450+ convoys and 9K+ Soldiers • Trained 1,100 Soldiers on electronic warfare principles and employment—increased tactical awareness greatly enhanced coalition convoy survivability • Developed rigorous OIF EW evaluations based on situational need—feedback to leadership persuaded increased compliance with Battalion commander’s directives by 30% • Restructured Army unit’s convoy commander and Counter Radio-controlled Electronic Warfare (CREW) specialist training courses—curriculum in-line with current Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures

description: Leads, supervises, manages, and mentors 96 employees in 13 work centers conducting entry and undergraduate level training courses in support of the Air Force’s Air Battle Manager program. Advises the Operations Director and Company Vice-President on the effective management of personnel and $30M in operations resources and training equipment. Provides operational leadership to training, standardization and evaluation, weapons and tactics, plans and programs, computer support, and scheduling functional areas. Mentors branch leaders on all HR functions and advises Company Director on recommended courses of action to address mission and/or personnel issues. • Managed/developed schedule of 9,056 live combat training events facilitating the training/graduation of 291 Air Battle Managers (ABM) • Program Manager for MU-2(training aircraft) contract; chaired safety meetings; addressed/resolved aircraft hours/issues with higher leadership—preserved training for 300 ABM students • Developed comprehensive procedures & checklists for off-station controlling—streamlined tasks & gained 140 new training sorties • Company’s representative at two Headquarters training conferences—contracted with 5 external agencies for 150 additional training events preventing delays in student training timelines
